Message: 1
Date: Thu, 31 Oct 2002 07:11:31 -0800 (PST)
From: Melanie Johnson <melanie_6602@...>
Subject: RE: VIRUS WARNING


I only check this email address from work, and the computers here are fine.
"LAINE. Mikael (Nol)" <laine@...> wrote:Heh, it's a good idea not to use your computer when you know you are infected with a virus, at least it's a good idea to stay away from the net to avoid spreading the virus.-----Original Message-----
From: Melanie Johnson [mailto:melanie_6602@...]
Sent: den 30 oktober 2002 16:23
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] VIRUS WARNING


Thanks for posting that link. Now maybe I can finally get rid of my Klez virus.
Matthew Bond <mattgbond@...> wrote: I was infected by a virus, which I have now cleaned from my system.
Please delete any messages from me that you recived within the last few
days, without opening them. I advise you to check your system for the
Klez or Bugbear viruses. You can download a free utility for cleaning
these viruses here:

http://vil.nai.com/vil/stinger/

Matt

Message: 2
Date: Thu, 31 Oct 2002 17:05:21 -0000
From: "Steven R. Hulse" <steveh@...>
Subject: Re: Digest Number 618

Hey cool a fellow Beta tester! I got into it also, I'm really
excited!

Well I don't know about it being a "kid's platform" I'm 33 and think
it will do great on the PS2. The only thing I think there might be
issues with regarding it's survival is the whol PS2 online part. I
don't know if there will be too many people that will get the adapter
or allow their kids to go online with it. Didn't Nintendo or another
gaming console maker try that a few years back but it failed?
Personally there were times I wish I had EQ for my PS2 simply to free
up my PC for other things. Like I can play EQ all day and the wife
won't have to yell at me to get off the PC so she can use it! LOL

You said a regular USB keyboard will work on the PS2? Thats cool, I
have one so now I won't have to go buy the PS2 specific one. You know
what would be great, if you could use those little USB storage
devices to save info on! God that would rock!

BTW since your also in the Beta, you can PM me anytime and we can
chat about the game. :)



________________________________________________________________________
________________________________________________________________________

Message: 3
Date: Thu, 31 Oct 2002 09:23:39 -0800 (PST)
From: David Langille <tuxedomystery2000@...>
Subject: Re: Digest Number 618


"Somebody who was in the Disney beta "
Disney Beta?
Jenn <juniper.jot@...> wrote:> Message: 5
> Date: Tue, 29 Oct 2002 19:08:52 -0000
> From: "Steven R. Hulse" <steveh@...>
> Subject: EQ Online Adventures for the PS2
>
> So is anyone besides me going to get this? I'm really excited about
> it and look forward to it coming out. I was just wondering if anyone
> else on this list was going to get it.
>
>
>
> ____________________________________________

EQOA is going to be fun. I got into the betas. Beta2 is going to start
soon. Some people may call it 'EQ-lite' but it's not really like that.
It's just as fun as EQ.
Anybody planning to buy it, buy the network adapter as soon as you see
it. They are sometimes hard to find. Also, buy a USB keyboard or a
regular keyboard with a USB adapter, keyboards make it much easier to
communicate.
Can't really tell any details of the game because of the EULA they make
us agree to.
Somebody who was in the Disney beta said that was actually much better
than you'd think a 'kid-themed MMOG' would be. Don't think I'd buy it
tho. Don't see it making it very long. May do well at first, but after
a while the kids will lose interest or grow out of it.
--

Message: 4
Date: Thu, 31 Oct 2002 08:10:47 -1000
From: "Steve C." <cotten@...>
Subject: Re: Re: Digest Number 618

Hi all!

I'm also a Beta tester. I'm 51. I was reading the posts on the Beta website
and the oldest person is 64, (so far), so all ages enjoy the game. Hope you
are wrong about people not playing because of difficulty getting hooked up.
Can you buy the network adapter online? I haven't started yet. When they
send the disks I'll get the adapter but I'm wondering if it will be hard to
find here in Hawaii. If they were smart they would make sure places like
Wal-Mart had em.

See ya in the game!
Steve

Message: 5
Date: Fri, 01 Nov 2002 02:13:11 -0000
From: "Steven R. Hulse" <steveh@...>
Subject: The Next EQ Meetup in Denver

Hi everyone!
Just wanted to post the date and time of the next EQ meetup here in
frozen Denver, Colorado!

Thursday, November 21 @ 7:00PM
(4th Thursday of every month.)

Currently the location is not set however if you can and want to
attend you can go to http://everquest.meetup.com sign up and vote on
a location!

Hope to see some of my fellow EQ'ers there!

C-ya!
